intro: Sesamoides cochleariifolia, commonly known as the ear-shaped sesamoid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ear-like leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
